article_text:
The Baltimore riots produced national lamentations about urban poverty, but don’t expect much to be done about it. Witness how the Maryland legislature gutted a charter-school reform that could have offered an escape for poor children.

Baltimore schools are some of the worst in the country. According to the 2013 National Assessment of Educational Progress, a mere 14% of Baltimore fourth graders and 16% of eighth graders were...

twitter.description: Progressives and unions gut a charter-school reform in Baltimore, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Bad Deal in Baltimore
